research_municipality_step.notes: Hamilton, TX operates under a Type A General Law form of government, which is a mayor-council system. The City Council consists of a Mayor and 5 Council Members, all elected at large for two-year terms. There was conflicting information regarding the Mayor; Richard Buchanan was listed in several sources, but a more recent article from December 2024 indicated Rodney Craddick as the new mayor. Therefore, Rodney Craddick has been listed as the current Mayor. One source also mentioned an open city council position with applications due in August 2025, but the listed officials represent the full council as identified in multiple sources.

validation_errors: Overall agreement score 74.05% is below the minimum threshold of 80%.
